intro: Trientalis borealis subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its whorled arrangement of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy white or pale yellow flowers in late spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife species.
